. O
Project O
02 O
: O
Concur O
Invoicing O
Concur O
Invoicing O
is O
an O
on O
- O
demand O
, O
Web O
- O
based O
A O
/ O
P O
application O
that O
will O
be O
implemented O
to O
automate O
the O
invoice O
approval O
and O
payment O
process O

. O
The O
application O
captures O
vendor O
/ O
supplier O
invoice O
data O
, O
and O
delivers O
workflow O
and O
approval O
capabilities O
not O
currently O
implemented O
in O
the O
SunSystems O
AP O
module O

. O
The O
intent O
is O
to O
decrease O
potential O
fraud O
and O
mistakes O
, O
while O
increasing O
control O
, O
compliance O
and O
visibility O
into O
invoice O
payment O
The O
proposed O
Concur O
Invoicing O
( O
workflow O
) O
solution O
should O
accomplish O
the O
following O
business O
objectives O
: O
Automate O
the O
current O
procure O
- O
to O
- O
pay O
process O
; O
Deliver O
an O
online O
solution O
capable O
of O
providing O
a O
vehicle O
for O
employees O
to O
enter O
invoices O
, O
route O
them O
for O
approval O
and O
remind O
approvers O
when O
time O
has O
elapsed O
for O
approval O
; O
Provide O
a O
workflow O
whereby O
Axis O
management O
can O
approve O
invoices O
; O
Allow O
for O
the O
automatic O
monitoring O
of O
policies O
; O
Provide O
accounting O
information O
to O
the O
Sun O
GL O
for O
all O
A O
/ O
P O
transactions O
; O
Monitor O
compliance O
to O
corporate O
policy O
and O
budget O
guidelines O
; O
Improve O
A O
/ O
P O
process O
efficiencies O
( O
as O
compared O
to O
the O
current O
manual O
process O
) O
; O
Provide O
the O
creation O
of O
Purchase O
Orders O
for O
the O
Information O
Technology O
department O

. O

in O
10.6.1 O
, O
VSS O
, O
SQL O
server O
2005 O
. O
Project O
02 O
: O
Concur O
Invoicing O
Concur O
Invoicing O
is O
an O
on O
- O
demand O
, O
Web O
- O
based O
A O
/ O
P O
application O
that O
will O
be O
implemented O
to O
automate O
the O
invoice O
approval O
and O
payment O
process O
. O
The O
application O
captures O
vendor O
/ O
supplier O
invoice O
data O
, O
and O
delivers O
workflow O
and O
approval O
capabilities O
not O
currently O
implemented O
in O
the O
SunSystems O
AP O
module O
. O
The O
intent O
is O
to O
decrease O
potential O
fraud O
and O
mistakes O
, O
while O
increasing O
control O
, O
compliance O
and O
visibility O
into O
invoice O
payment O
The O
proposed O
Concur O
Invoicing O
( O
workflow O
) O
solution O
should O
accomplish O
the O
following O
business O
objectives O
: O
Automate O
the O
current O
procure O
- O
to O
- O
pay O
process O
; O
Deliver O
an O
online O
solution O
capable O
of O
providing O
a O
vehicle O
for O
employees O
to O
enter O
invoices O
, O
route O
them O
for O
approval O
and O
remind O
approvers O
when O
time O
has O
elapsed O
for O
approval O
; O
Provide O
a O
workflow O
whereby O
Axis O
management O
can O
approve O
invoices O
; O
Allow O
for O
the O
automatic O
monitoring O
of O
policies O
; O
Provide O
accounting O
information O
to O
the O
Sun O
GL O
for O
all O
A O
/ O
P O
transactions O
; O
Monitor O
compliance O
to O
corporate O
policy O
and O
budget O
guidelines O
; O
Improve O
A O
/ O
P O
process O
efficiencies O
( O
as O
compared O
to O
the O
current O
manual O
process O
) O
; O
Provide O
the O
creation O
of O
Purchase O
Orders O
for O
the O
Information O
Technology O
department O
. O

The O

Now O
. O
Project O
: O
Accord O
( O

Project O
US O
EPG O
Forecast O
Workbook O
( O
FWB O
) O
application O
is O
designed O
to O
support O
the O
US O
Enterprise O
Partner O
Group O
( O
US O
EPG O
) O
in O
producing O
and O
maintaining O
the O
monthly O
US O
sales O
forecast O

. O
It O
is O
a O
transactional O
database O
combined O
with O
Microsoft O
Office O
Excel O
functionality O
that O
enables O
end O
users O
to O
interact O
with O
the O
USNAForecast O
database O

. O
Typically O
, O
an O
ATU O
manager O
will O
connect O
to O
the O
corporate O
network O
and O
download O
data O
from O
the O
forecast O
database O
, O
which O
creates O
an O
offline O
forecast O
workbook O

. O
This O
data O
can O
then O
be O
accessed O
offline O
, O
modelled O
, O
and O
changes O
to O
certain O
data O
fields O
are O
subsequently O
uploaded O
back O
to O
the O
forecast O
database O
through O
a O
CorpNet O
connection O

. O
These O
changes O
are O
then O
stored O
in O
the O
online O
database O
and O
subsequently O
loaded O
back O
into O
upstream O
systems O

. O

MICROSOFT O
- O

- O
August O
2011 O
to O
June O
2016 O
Project O
US O
EPG O
Forecast O
Workbook O
( O
FWB O
) O
application O
is O
designed O
to O
support O
the O
US O
Enterprise O
Partner O
Group O
( O
US O
EPG O
) O
in O
producing O
and O
maintaining O
the O
monthly O
US O
sales O
forecast O
. O
It O
is O
a O
transactional O
database O
combined O
with O
Microsoft O
Office O
Excel O
functionality O
that O
enables O
end O
users O
to O
interact O
with O
the O
USNAForecast O
database O
. O
Typically O
, O
an O
ATU O
manager O
will O
connect O
to O
the O
corporate O
network O
and O
download O
data O
from O
the O
forecast O
database O
, O
which O
creates O
an O
offline O
forecast O
workbook O
. O
This O
data O
can O
then O
be O
accessed O
offline O
, O
modelled O
, O
and O
changes O
to O
certain O
data O
fields O
are O
subsequently O
uploaded O
back O
to O
the O
forecast O
database O
through O
a O
CorpNet O
connection O
. O
These O
changes O
are O
then O
stored O
in O
the O
online O
database O
and O
subsequently O
loaded O
back O
into O
upstream O
systems O
. O
Responsibilities O

• O

in O
the O

discussions O
/ O

and O
efforts O
estimations O

RELEASES O
Hornet O
DESCRIPTION O
• O
IPv6 O
, O
formerly O
named O
IPng O
( O
next O
generation O
) O
, O
is O
the O
latest O
version O
of O
the O
Internet O
Protocol O
( O
IP O
) O

. O
IP O
is O
a O
packet O
- O
based O
protocol O
used O
to O
exchange O
data O
, O
voice O
, O
and O
video O
traffic O
over O
digital O
networks O
• O
Cisco O
's O
Wide O
- O
Area O
Application O
Services O
IPv4 O
users O
can O
move O
to O
IPv6 O
and O
receive O
services O
such O
as O
end O
- O
to O
- O
end O
security O
, O
quality O
of O
service O
( O
QoS O
) O
, O
and O
globally O
unique O
addresses O

. O
The O
IPv6 O
address O
space O
reduces O
the O
need O
for O
private O
addresses O
and O
Network O
Address O
Translation O
( O
NAT O
) O
processing O
by O
border O
routers O
at O
network O
edges O

. O
• O
Implementing O
basic O
IPv6 O
connectivity O
in O
the O
Cisco O
IOS O
software O
consists O
of O
assigning O
IPv6 O
addresses O
to O
individual O
router O
interfaces O

. O
The O
forwarding O
of O
IPv6 O
traffic O
can O
be O
enabled O
globally O
, O
and O
Cisco O
Express O
Forwarding O
switching O
for O
IPv6 O
can O
also O
be O
enabled O
• O
The O
primary O
motivation O
for O
IPv6 O
is O
the O
need O
to O
meet O
the O
demand O
for O
globally O
unique O
IP O
addresses O

. O
• O
Mainly O
involves O
to O
checks O
the O
functionality O
of O
all O
waas O
features O
to O
work O
with O
v6 O
addressing O

( O

DESCRIPTION O
• O
Wide O
Area O
Application O
Services O
( O
WAAS O
) O
is O
a O
Cisco "B-Companies worked at"
Systems "L-Companies worked at"
technology O
that O
improves O
the O
performance O
of O
applications O
on O
a O
wide O
area O
network O
( O
WAN O
) O

. O
WAAS O
combines O
Cisco O
's O
Wide O
Area O
File O
Services O
( O
WAFS O
- O
products O
allow O
remote O
office O
users O
to O
access O
and O
share O
files O
globally O
at O
LAN O
speeds O
over O
the O
WAN O
) O
with O
WAN O
optimization O
inside O
of O
a O
router O
, O
accelerating O
TCP O
- O
based O
applications O
on O
a O
given O
network O

. O
• O
WAAS O
system O
consists O
of O
a O
set O
of O
devices O
called O
wide O
area O
application O
engines O
( O
WAEs O
) O
that O
work O
together O
to O
optimize O
TCP O
traffic O
over O
your O
network O

. O
When O
client O
and O
server O
applications O
attempt O
to O
communicate O
with O
each O
other O
, O
the O
network O
intercepts O
and O
redirects O
this O
traffic O
to O
the O
WAEs O
so O
that O
they O
can O
act O
on O
behalf O
of O
the O
client O
application O
and O
the O
destination O
server O

. O
• O
The O
WAEs O
examine O
the O
traffic O
and O
use O
built O
- O
in O
application O
policies O
to O
determine O
whether O
to O
optimize O
the O
traffic O
or O
allow O
it O
to O
pass O
through O
your O
network O
un O
optimized O
• O
Mainly O
involves O
optimizing O
the O
various O
Ao O
's O
like O
HTTP O
, O
SSL O
, O
HTTPS O
and O
functional O
wise O
platform O
check O

. O

DESCRIPTION O

• O
IPv6 O
, O
formerly O
named O
IPng O
( O
next O
generation O
) O
, O
is O
the O
latest O
version O
of O
the O
Internet O
Protocol O
( O
IP O
) O
. O
IP O
is O
a O
packet O
- O
based O
protocol O
used O
to O
exchange O
data O
, O
voice O
, O
and O
video O
traffic O
over O
digital O
networks O

• O
Cisco O
's O
Wide O
- O
Area O
Application O
Services O
IPv4 O
users O
can O
move O
to O
IPv6 O
and O
receive O
services O
such O
as O
end O
- O
to O
- O
end O
security O
, O
quality O
of O
service O
( O
QoS O
) O
, O
and O
globally O
unique O
addresses O
. O
The O
IPv6 O
address O
space O
reduces O
the O
need O
for O
private O
addresses O
and O
Network O
Address O
Translation O
( O
NAT O
) O
processing O
by O
border O
routers O
at O
network O
edges O
. O

• O
Implementing O
basic O
IPv6 O
connectivity O
in O
the O
Cisco O
IOS O
software O
consists O
of O
assigning O
IPv6 O
addresses O
to O
individual O
router O
interfaces O
. O
The O
forwarding O
of O
IPv6 O
traffic O
can O
be O
enabled O
globally O
, O
and O
Cisco O
Express O
Forwarding O
switching O
for O
IPv6 O
can O
also O
be O
enabled O

• O
The O
primary O
motivation O
for O
IPv6 O
is O
the O
need O
to O
meet O
the O
demand O
for O
globally O
unique O
IP O
addresses O
. O

• O
Mainly O
involves O
to O
checks O
the O
functionality O
of O
all O
waas O
features O
to O
work O
with O
v6 O
addressing O

My O
